title: Strictly Come Dancing 2015: Take a sneak peek at the celebrities in training this week
text:
Strictly Come Dancing 2015: Take a sneak peek at the celebrities in training this week Strictly Come Dancing 2015: Take a sneak peek at the celebrities in training this week Share 
The cast of Strictly have been hanging out a lot together. Bonding time? 
But theyâ€™ve also been getting down to some hard work in rehearsal rooms across the country. Hereâ€™s how the couples have been getting on: Anita Rani and Gleb Savchenko 
Anita and Gleb are dancing the Tango to Temper Trapâ€™s Sweet Disposition â€“ although Gleb had to go on a coffee run for his celebrity partner. May be it take two to tango but @itsanitarani can't tango without a coffee @bbcstrictly #teamGLITA pic.twitter.com/A7aNALUqhg 
â€” GLEB SAVCHENKO (@Gleb_Savchenko) October 21, 2015 
But itâ€™s not just coffee thatâ€™s on her mind: All I think about is dancing and food #strictly 
â€” anita rani (@itsanitarani) October 22, 2015 
Anita has also been fraternising with the competition â€“ hanging out with Jay on Londonâ€™s South Bank. 
And sheâ€™s clearly been making Gleb work hard, according to this sweaty selfie captioned: â€œRehearsals done for today.â€ Carol Kirkwood and Pasha Kovalev 
Carol and Pasha are dancing the Viennese Waltz to Sealâ€™s Iâ€™ve Been Loving You Too Long â€“ although Carol will have to overcome her â€œdiscombobulationâ€ first, after this very sweet conversation with Bryan Adams. Promoted stories Aw shucks! This is very cute â€“ @bryanadams and @carolkirkwood speaking to each other yesterday on @bbcbreakfast :) https://t.co/fMnuoOkulO 
â€” BBC Breakfast (@BBCBreakfast) October 22, 2015 Georgia May Foote and Giovanni Pernice 
Georgia and Giovanni are dancing the Salsa to Sylvesterâ€™s You Make Me Feel (Mighty Real) â€“ though itâ€™s been a painful ride for the ex-Corrie star so far: So we are practicing lifts for this weeks salsa todayâ€¦ One wordâ€¦ OUCH! #help #ithurts ğŸ˜¢ 
â€” Georgia May Foote (@georgiafoote) October 19, 2015 
Still â€“ she was excited to be back on the Strictly dance floor: 
And the turns are going excellently. 
â€” Georgia & Giovanni (@TeamGGstrictly) October 22, 2015 Helen George and Aljaz Skorjanec 
Helen and Aljaz are doing the Quickstep to Diana Ross and the Supremesâ€™s You Canâ€™t Hurry Love, and theyâ€™ve got their footwear sorted. 
â€” Aljaz Skorjanec (@AljazSkorjanec) October 21, 2015 Jamelia and Tristan MacManus 
Jamelia and Tristan are dancing the Foxtrot to Celine Dionâ€™s Because You Loved Me. 
They enjoyed their appearance on It Takes Two earlier this week. Had so much fun on It Takes Two Today with this Jay McGuiness and Aliona Vilani 
Jay and Aliona are doing the Paso to Bon Joviâ€™s Itâ€™s My Life, and they are ready for the dance floor. After a week of this @JayMcGuiness and @AlionaVilani are ready ğŸ‘ŠğŸ» bring on tomorrow night!! #Strictly #TeamJaliona pic.twitter.com/JxNpFdk9pN 
â€” Crown Media Mgt (@CrownMediaMgt) October 23, 2015 
(Even if they love fooling around.) Dance monkeys dance! @AlionaVilani It's Ali & Jay, with the Paso Doble, on #DanceSelfieDay pic.twitter.com/8rV8v8EQVA 
â€” Jay McGuiness (@JayMcGuiness) October 21, 2015 
And this is what their hair will look like! Ainsley Harriott and Natalie Lowe 
Ainsley and Natalie are doing the Jive to Bill Haley and the Cometsâ€™s Shake Rattle and Roll. Theyâ€™ve been pretty quiet on social media â€“ but Natalie shared this shot of the pro dance: #Scd pro's are @elstreestudios blocking this weeks pro dance! Very colourful routine choreography by Karen Bruce pic.twitter.com/VyEXfVIqV2 
â€” Natalie Lowe (@RealNatalieLowe) October 19, 2015 Jeremy Vine and Karen Clifton 
Jeremy and Karen are dancing the Waltz to Elvis Costelloâ€™s She â€“ although Jeremy also had a chance this week to reprise his weirdest dance move yet: . @thejeremyvine takes his floor spin move a tad too far!â€¦ Weâ€™ve never seen tidying like it! @karen_hauer #ItTakesTwo pic.twitter.com/s4XLcuqzqd 
â€” BBC Strictly (@bbcstrictly) October 22, 2015 
They also struck this very elegant pose: 
â€” Karen Clifton (@karen_hauer) October 21, 2015 Katie Derham and Anton Du Beke 
Katie and Anton are dancing the Salsa to Michael Bubleâ€™s It Had Better Be Tonight â€“ and Anton is still basking in the delight of topping the leader board last week. Was it only 12 years? Felt like longer!! X https://t.co/oG7uyPK2fS 
â€” Anton Du Beke (@TheAntonDuBeke) October 17, 2015 
Katie is pretty happy too. Catching up with all your AMAZING tweets about last night! I think this photo sums up how we felt! @TheAntonDuBeke pic.twitter.com/IKoJm8Y9dq 
â€” Katie Derham (@thekatiederham) October 18, 2015 
But whatâ€™s going on in their rehearsal room? Thatâ€™s still under wraps. Kellie Bright and Kevin Clifton 
Kellie and Kevin are doing the Jive to One Directionâ€™s One Way or Another â€“ but first of all, Kellie will have to reclaim her professional partner from It Takes Two host Zoe Ball. 
â€” BBC Strictly (@bbcstrictly) October 20, 2015 
Kevin also did this cute photo shoot with his wife Karen. Its Wear It Pink day @breastcancernow pic.twitter.com/e1VC1RkJpu 
â€” Kevin Clifton (@keviclifton) October 23, 2015 Kirsty Gallacher and Brendan Cole 
Kirsty and Brendan are dancing the Viennese Waltz to David Grayâ€™s This Yearâ€™s Love, and Kirsty shared this clip of her professional partner choreographing the dance â€“ in deepest concentration. 
The two paid a visit to the Strictly dance floor to prepare for Saturday night. 
â€” Brendan Cole (@BrendanCole) October 23, 2015 Peter Andre and Janette Manrana 
Peter and Janette are dancing the Rumba to Ed Sheeranâ€™s Thinking Out Loud â€“ with the Aussie pop star taking a little break to thank fans for getting his latest album to number three in the charts. 
And they have, hands down, the best rehearsal room of all the Strictly couples. Rumba this weekâ€¦. â¤ï¸ pic.twitter.com/Es0WNwQfvc 
â€” Janette Manrara (@JManrara) October 20, 2015 Share article 
Strictly Come Dancing airs at 6.35pm on Saturday, October 24 on BBC One. Promoted Stories
